abstractText: A Robel pole (Robel 1975) is used to document vertical and/or horizontal cover for herbaceous vegetation i.e., visual obstruction readings (VOR). Measurements are recorded at 20, 25, or 50-foot intervals. Intervals are determined by the length of each transect, i.e., a minimum of 12 measurements are required for each transect, or cover type heterogeneity (structurally diverse cover types generally require larger sample sizes).VOR samples are considered independent for statistical purposes.
title: Visual Obstruction Readings (VOR) v1.0
